Job Title:Research & Development Intern - Summer 2026Job Description:Research & Development Intern - Summer 2026Here at Entegris, we use advanced science to enable technologies that transform the world, and we are seeking employees who have the drive to continue the mission.The Role:Our site in San Luis Obispo, CA is seeking a/an Research & Development Intern to join our team for the Summer 2026 season. This assignment is intended to be 12-14 weeks in duration.In this role, the intern will assist the R&D team in documenting both historical data and new data we are collecting. They will have an opportunity to learn basic experimental design and documentation of results for the transfer of qualification testing to the analytical team.What You’ll Do:• Conduct thorough tests to evaluate the effectiveness of the process and ensure the validity of results• Review test information to summarize media quality• Performance using pre-existing qualification data• Review and update all current documents to meet the new standard templates• Document the final test procedure for seamless transfer to the QA laboratories• Assist in build up and transfer of test setup to new quality labWhat We Seek:• Detail-oriented• Data analytics skills• Ability to interpret and present dataDesired Major(s) & Graduation Year:• Chemistry• Chemical Engineering• Mechanical Engineering• Industrial Engineering• Graduation date of December 2027 or laterEligibility• Entegris does not provide immigration-related sponsorship for this role. Do not apply for this role if you will need Entegris immigration sponsorship (e.g., H1B, TN, STEM OPT, etc.) now or in the future.• Must be a currently enrolled student• Available to work 40 hours a week, M-F (8a-5p) beginning in mid-May/June through August/September.• Must be familiar with the universities requirements to participate in an internship program• PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Must be able to lift up to 50lbs, reach and lift tools above head, and climb laddersWhy Work at EntegrisLead. Inspire. Innovate. Define Your Future. Not everyone who works for a global company shares the same background, experiences and perspectives. We leverage the differences of our employees to bring new ideas to the table. Every employee throughout the company is encouraged to share input on projects and initiatives. Our decision-making process is truly a collaborative effort as we realize there are leaders at every level of the organization. We put our values at the core of how we operate as an organization — not just when it’s convenient, but in a lasting and meaningful way. We want the time and energy you spend here to have a positive impact on your life inside and outside of the office.What We OfferOur total rewards package goes above and beyond just a paycheck. Whether you’re looking to build your career, improve your health, or protect your wealth, we offer generous benefits to help you achieve your goals.• Generous 401(K) plan with an impressive employer match• Excellent health packages to fit your needs• Flexible work schedule with paid holidays and sick time• Values-driven culture with colleagues that rally around People, Accountability, Creativity and ExcellenceCompensation: $25-$30/per hour range with actual pay dependent on candidate overall skills for the role.Entegris does not provide immigration-related sponsorship for this role. Do not apply for this role if you will need Entegris immigration sponsorship (e.g., H1B, TN, STEM OPT, etc.) now or in the future.#LI-MW1

Job Title:Nanoparticle Research Associate Intern - Summer 2026Job Description:Here at Entegris, we use advanced science to enable technologies that transform the world, and we are seeking employees who have the drive to continue the mission.The Role:Our site in Aurora, IL is seeking a/an Nanoparticle Research Associate Intern to join our team for the Summer 2026 season. This assignment is intended to be 12-14 weeks in duration.Hiring a nanoparticle intern focused on Chemical and Mechanical Planarization (CMP) applications will substantially strengthen our organization’s capacity for innovation, operational efficiency, and sustained competitive advantage. By leveraging specialized expertise in nanotechnology and materials science, this role provides you an opportunity to help accelerate the development of advanced solutions, ensuring our team remains at the forefront of technological progress.What You’ll Do:• Nanoparticles: Support the preparation and characterization of nanoparticles for CMP applications.• Surface Modification: Perform surface modification experiments utilizing silane chemistry to optimize nanoparticle performance.• Surface Characterization: Apply advanced analytical techniques, including electron microscopy, nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy, and thermogravimetric analysis, to assess surface properties and modifications.• Data Analysis: Interpret experimental results, prepare comprehensive reports, and present findings to the research team.• Collaboration: Partner effectively with team members to execute project objectives and actively contribute to laboratory meetings with technical insights and recommendations.What We Seek:• Knowledge: Completed coursework in organic and inorganic chemistry, demonstrating a strong theoretical foundation.• Laboratory Skills: Proficient in chemical laboratory techniques, including safe handling of chemicals and materials; completed organic and inorganic laboratory courses.• Analytical Skills: Skilled in data analysis and interpretation to support research conclusions.• Team Collaboration: Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a proactive approach to teamwork and knowledge sharing.• Attention to Detail: Highly organized with exceptional accuracy and precision in experimental work and documentation.Desired Major(s) & Graduation Year:• Currently enrolled in a degree program in Chemistry, Materials Science, Biochemistry, Nanotechnology or related field• Graduation years: 2026 or 2027Eligibility• Must be a currently enrolled student• Available to work 40 hours a week, M-F (8a-5p) beginning in mid-May/June through August/September.• Must be familiar with the universities requirements to participate in an internship programPHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Will need to be in laboratory environment for 6-8 hours. Must be able to move filled 5-gallon buckets of mostly water.Why Work at EntegrisLead. Inspire. Innovate. Define Your Future. Not everyone who works for a global company shares the same background, experiences and perspectives. We leverage the differences of our employees to bring new ideas to the table. Every employee throughout the company is encouraged to share input on projects and initiatives. Our decision-making process is truly a collaborative effort as we realize there are leaders at every level of the organization. We put our values at the core of how we operate as an organization — not just when it’s convenient, but in a lasting and meaningful way. We want the time and energy you spend here to have a positive impact on your life inside and outside of the office.What We OfferOur total rewards package goes above and beyond just a paycheck. Whether you’re looking to build your career, improve your health, or protect your wealth, we offer generous benefits to help you achieve your goals.• Generous 401(K) plan with an impressive employer match• Excellent health packages to fit your needs• Flexible work schedule with paid holidays and sick time• Values-driven culture with colleagues that rally around People, Accountability, Creativity and ExcellenceCompensation: $20-$32 hourly range with actual pay dependent on graduation year and candidate skillset.Entegris does not provide immigration-related sponsorship for this role. Do not apply for this role if you will need Entegris immigration sponsorship (e.g., H1B, TN, STEM OPT, etc.) now or in the future.At Entegris we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. Our policy is to recruit, hire, train, and reward employees for their individual abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, marital or military status.
Join Wing in this exciting opportunity.
